page.title: 09Adisham Transport and Use
page.content: Adisham's main transport is the private car. Younger families and wealthier older people run a car, some had two, and most wives drive. Cars are used for commuting to work, shopping, and to go to entertainments, sport and holidays. Some also have caravans. Most children have cycles and a few adults have a cycle or motorcycle. The unman- ned railway station is a quarter mile from the village. It is the main Dover, Canterbury, London line and trains stop every hour. Trains are used by numerous people to get to and from schools and work also for shopping and recreational visits. The bus service from Canterbury to Goodnestone only runs on Wednesday and Saturday but goes into the village, being mainly used by the elderly. Bossington has no bus service and the station is over a mile away.
